dialogues.text: A NAKED LIGHTBULB SPARKS TO LIFE. It dangles from the cei of a basement. LIGHT, QUICK FOOTSTEPS AS ANNA CROWE moves down the stair Anna is the rare combination of beauty and innocence. She stands in the chilly basement in an elegant summer dress that outlines her slender body. Her gentle eyes move acro the empty room and come to rest on a rack of wine bottles covering one entire wall. She walks to the bottles. Her fingertips slide over the labels. She stops when she finds just the right one. A tiny smile as she slides it out. Anna turns to leave. Stops. She stares at the shadowy basement. It's an unsettling place. She stands very still and watches her breath form a TINY CLOUD IN THE COLD AIR. She's visibly uncomfortable. Anna Crowe moves for the staircase in a hurry. Each step faster than the next. She climbs out of the basement in another burst of LIGHT, QUICK FOOTSTEPS. WE HEAR HER HIT THE LIGHT SWITCH. THE LIGHTBULB DIES. DRIPPING BLACK DEVOURS THE ROOM.

dialogues.text: (shaken) Something you were looking for, baby? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (shaken) Pop Tarts. Lynn looks over to the open cabinet near the sink. The po tarts are clearly visible.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: They're right here.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Oh. Cole gets up from the table. Takes his pop tarts. Doesn't make eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What are you thinking, Momma?

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Lots of things.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Anything bad about me? Lynn leans down.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Look at my face. Cole does.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: I wasn't thinking anything bad about you, got it? He looks at her eyes. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Got it. THE DOOR BELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (soft) That's Tommy, Momma. Cole quietly kisses his mother on the cheek and starts ou  19.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Don't you want this? Cole turns to see Lynn holding the pop tarts. He walks ba and takes them from her before leaving. Beat. Lynn glances to the kitchen table. Her gaze stops o the TWO TINY HAND PRINTS OF SWEAT formed on the table's surface. Lynn stands motionless in the kitchen. She looks up and wraps her arms around her shivering shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY TAMMISIMO is a tough-looking, eight-year-old Italia kid who waits at the bottom of Cole's brownstone stairs i his school uniform. Cole emerges from the brownstone and moves down the steps Lynn's face appears in the kitchen window. The two boys begin their walk down the street to school. Tommy puts his arm around Cole. Lynn waves. Cole waves back. When the two boys turn the corner and are out of Lynn's s Tommy rips his arm away.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Hey freak, how'd you like the "arm around your shoulder" bit. I just made it up. Went with it. That's what great actors do. It's called improv. Tommy starts to run ahead, he turns and back pedals.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: (taunting) Be careful... I hope no one jumps out and gets you. Tommy runs away. Beat. Cole looks around nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last uniformed boys and girls rush into the front doo of St. Anthony's Academy as the FINAL BELL SOUNDS.  20. Cole is the last one to go in. He stands alone on the sidewalk. He looks like he'd rather be anywhere but there Beat. He buries his hands in his pockets and begins a quiet wal by himself into the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door CREAKS open as Cole walks in after school. He looks around before closing the door. His eyes stop on Lynn seated in the open doorway of the den. Malcolm is se with her. They both look up. Lynn comes out. She reaches Cole -- kneels down in front him.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: (whispers) How was school, baby? Cole shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: (whispers) You know, you can tell me things if you need to. Cole doesn't respond. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: (whispers) Well, you know what I did today? Cole shakes his head "No."

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: (whispers) I won the Pennsylvania Lottery in the morning. I quit my jobs. Ate a big picnic in the park with lots of chocolate mouses pie and then swam in the fountain all afternoon... (smiling) What did you do? Cole starts to smile too. He thinks.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (whispers) I was picked first for kickball teams at recess.  21.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I hit a grand slam to win the game and everyone lifted me up on their shoulders and carried me around cheering. Cole and Lynn smile at each other. Beat. Lynn tries to hide the utter sadness behind her smile.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: I'll make triangle pancakes. You got an hour. Lynn takes Cole's school bag and jacket before moving to kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The den doubles as a playroom. Boxes of old toys sit in t regen A small, plastic, multi-colored table sits on the Cole appears in the doorway. Malcolm sits up and smiles. He points to the chair on the other side of the coffee ta

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You want to sit? Cole nods very softly, "No."

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Don't feel like talking right now? Cole nods again very softly, "No."

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: How about we play a game first? Cole looks a little more interested.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: It's a mind-reading game... Did I mention I could read minds? Cole nods, "No."

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Here's the game. I'll read your mind. If what I say is right, you take a stop forwards the chair.  22.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: If I'm wrong, you take a step backwards the doorway. If you reach the chair, you sit. If you reach the door, you can go. Deal? Cole tilts his head, then nods, "Yes." Malcolm presses his fingers to his temples like a vaudevi magician. He closes his eyes tight.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Just after your mom and dad were divorced, your mom went to a doctor like me and it didn't help her. And so you think I'm not going to help you. Beat. Cole, surprised, takes a small step forward.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You're worried because she said she told him things. Things she couldn't tell anybody else. (beat ) Secrets. Cole takes a step. Malcolm opens his eyes. He looks right at Cole.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You have a secret. But you don't want to tell me. Beat. Cole takes another step. The next step will put him at the chair. Malcolm lowers his fingers from his temple.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (whispers) You don't have to tell me your secret if you don't want to. Malcolm smiles. Returns his fingers to the mind-reading position. Malcolm looks to Cole's arm. Cole is wearing A LARGE SILVER WATCH. It swims on his thin wrist. It could probably slide up to his shoulder. Malcolm closes his eye

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Your father gave you that watch as a present before he left. Cole takes a step BACK. Beat. Malcolm lowers his hands surprised.  23.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: He forgot it in a drawer. It doesn't work. Beat. Malcolm puts his fingers to his temple. This time a little bit slower. He gazes at Cole's school uniform.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You don't like to say much at school. You're an excellent student however. You've never been in any kind of serious trouble. Beat. Cole takes a slow step back. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: We were supposed to draw a picture. Anything we wanted... I drew a man. He got hurt in the neck by another man with a screwdriver. AN UNCOMFORTABLE SILENCE OVERTAKES THE DEN.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You saw that on T.V., Cole? Cole answers by taking a small step back. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Everybody got upset. They had a meeting. Momma started crying. (beat ) I don't draw like that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: How do you draw now?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I draw people with smiles, dogs running, and rainbows. (beat ) They don't have meetings about rainbows.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (soft) I guess they don't. Malcolm looks down at Cole's feet. They're almost at the doorway. One more step and he's there. Cole is very still He doesn't move at all.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (whispers) What am I thinking now?  24. Malcolm takes his time before speaking. He just stares. N fingers to the temple. No games. He just stares. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You're thinking... (beat ) I don't know what you're thinking, Cole. Cole quietly takes a step back into the doorway of the ot room.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (whispers) I was thinking... you're nice. (beat ) But you can't help me. Cole's tiny figure steps away. Malcolm stares helplessly the empty doorway where his client used to stand. THE DEN IS SUFFOCATED WITH SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm hurriedly enters a spacious, dimly-lit Italian restaurant. He stops in the dining room and searches the many candle-lit tables. He finds Anna. Anna sits alone at a corner table. The remains of her hal eaten dinner lay on the only place setting on the table. small PIECE OF CAKE WITH A CANDLE in it sits untouched. Anna stirs sugar in her coffee as Malcolm sits in the sea across from her. She gently stops stirring, but doesn't look up. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I thought you meant the other Italian restaurant I asked you to marry me in. Anna isn't laughing. Not even close.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. (beat ) I can't seem to keep track of time. Anna quietly takes a sip from her coffee.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: It didn't go well today.  25.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Spent some time after trying to get my head together. Anna looks around for the waiter.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: They're so similar, Anna. They have the same mannerisms. The same expressions. The same thing hanging over them. (beat ) It might be some kind of abuse. That makes Anna turn back. She glances across the table, then looks down.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: There are cuts on Cole's arms. Fingernail marks, I think. Looks like defensive cuts. Malcolm demonstrates by holding up his arm to shield his face.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (beat ) Possibly a teacher, neighbor. (beat ) I don't think it's the mother. Just a gut thing. The way she deals with him. It doesn't fit. (beat ) Hard to say this early. Could just be a child climbing a lot of trees. Malcolm loses himself in his thoughts. The waiter drops o the check on the table. Anna grabs it before Malcolm and quickly signs it.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I know I've been kind of out of it for a long while and you resent it. You do. I know you're mad. I know it's put some distance between us. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: But I'm getting a second chance here. I can't let it slip away. Anna waits till he's done and rises from the table. She pushes her chair in hard and walks away without a word.  26. Malcolm sits alone and stares at the piece of cake with a candle on it.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (soft) ...Happy Anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole is seated on the front stoop of his brownstone. On t steps and on the landing are his plastic soldiers in the grips of a war. Malcolm sits with his bag and overcoat on the step next t him. Malcolm just observes quietly. Beat. Cole glances up as he plays. Sees Malcolm's expression.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You want to ask me a question?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: See, this is why I lose at poker. Yes, I do have a question. On the step are two rows of soldiers facing each other. T one side are a couple soldiers covered by a tissue. Malco points to them.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: What happened to those two? Being under tissue paper can't be a good thing. Cole removes the tissue.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: That's Private Jenkins and Private Kinney. They got killed. Private Jenkins has a baby girl that was born seven pounds, six ounces. He's never seen her. He wanted to get back to Blue Bell, Pennsylvania and hold her... Cole points to the other soldier.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Private Kinney's wife is really sick -- she has something called a brain anism,  27.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (soft) You mean aneurysm.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, Private Kinney needed to get back safe to take care of her. Beat. Cole's face becomes emotional. Tears fill his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: It's sad they died, isn't it? Malcolm falls into silence and stares at his client. Beat Cole wipes his eyes quickly.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Don't look at me. (beat ) I don't like people looking at me like that. Malcolm takes in Cole's gesture and expression.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Stop looking at me. Malcolm looks down.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Where should I look then, Cole?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Look over there. Cole points to the corner of the street. Malcolm slowly turns. He sits in profile to Cole. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: It's very unusual for someone your age to understand the kind of problems that Private Jenkins and Private Kinney have or even to be thinking about them at all... Malcolm continues to stare at the street. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: It is okay if I look back now? Cole doesn't answer.  28.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Tap the foot once for "No" and twice for "Yes." Cole taps his foot once. Malcolm sits patiently. Beat. They don't say anything for a while.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You wouldn't want to take a walk, would you? Cole looks up from his soldiers. Malcolm stares at the fa side of the street. Cole taps his foot twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them walk down a row of brownstones across fro park where children Cole's age are playing.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I walk this way to school with Tommy Tammisimo.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: He your best buddy? Cole almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: He hates me.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You hate him? Cole shakes his head, "No. ! Malcolm thinks for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Your mom set that up? Cole nods "Yes."

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You ever tell her about how it is with Tommy?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I don't tell her a thing.  29.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Cause she doesn't look at me like everybody and I don't want her to. I don't want her to know.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: That I'm a freak. Malcolm stops walking. The words hit him hard. He stares at Cole.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Listen to me. You are not a freak. Don't you believe anybody that tells you that. It's bullshit and you don't have to grow up believing that. Beat. Cole is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You said the "s" word.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sorry. Malcolm's face is filled with emotion. Cole is suddenly h by Malcolm's passion. Beat. Cole nods slowly as he looks at Malcolm with different eyes. They start walking again in silence. They turn a corner a move down another street. Cole spots an old man with a ca standing at the gate of a brownstone.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Is it okay if I do something? I have to do something. Malcolm nods "yes" as they continue walking. Cole slows a they approach the old man. As we get closer, we make out the man can barely see.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Marschal. MR. MARSCHAL leans over his gate and stares at Cole fora few seconds.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MARSCHAL
dialogues.text: Guten Tag, Cole.  30. Mr. Marschal has a thick German accent. The old man squin down the block with a concerned expression.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: MR. MARSCHAL
dialogues.text: Mrs. Marschal. She went food shopping. She's running late. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Ich Habe Durst. Malcolm's eyes dart to Cole.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MARSCHAL
dialogues.text: Wunderbar! Where did you learn to speak German?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I just know a couple lines.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MARSCHAL
dialogues.text: Yes, you may have a drink. What would you like?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Lemonade, please. Mr. Marschal smiles at Cole before walking back inside hi house. Cole turns back to Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (sad) Mr. Marschal gets real lonely.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: What about Mrs. Marschal?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (whispers) She died a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This brownstone has been home to the Marschal's for many, many years. It's filled with a lifetime of memories. Memories shared by two people.  31. Two rocking chairs sit side by side near the windows that overlook the street... A corner table displays fancy wood chess set. The game half-finished, frozen in a layer of dust... An easel stands before a piano. The incomplete water colo painting of a smiling elderly woman sitting on the piano bench sits sadly on the faded yellow paper. Malcolm takes in the living room silently. He stands near the open door. Cole walks through the room. Tiny eyes searching carefull He leans behind the sofa looking for something. Malcolm watches Cole with a crinkled brow. Cole peeks behind the old piano crammed against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MARSCHAL
dialogues.text: Maybe Jill will play for us when she gets back. Cole turns to find Mr. Marschal standing with a glass of lemonade. Cole takes it from his shaking hands.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Mr. Marschal shuffles over to the sofa. Takes a seat. Cole begins surveying the room again. Beat. His eyes fina come to rest on a plant seated in the corner. He stares a it... THE LEAVES OF THE PLANT SHAKE SLIGHTLY FROM A BREEZ Cole puts down his glass on a table and walks over to the plant. Cole kneels down and starts to push the potted pla aside. THE POT SCREECHES ON THE WOODEN FLOOR. Malcolm calls to Cole under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Cole--

dialogues.speaker: MR. MARSCHAL
dialogues.text: What's going on there? Mr. Marschal strains to see across the room. Cole doesn't answer either of them. Instead, he continues to push the plant aside revealing AN AIR VENT. Cole gentl reaches over and takes off the metal face. It slips right off. Cole's hands disappear into the darkness of the vent. The reemerge holding a STACK OF NOTEBOOKS.  32. Malcolm becomes very still. Cole rises to his feet and carries the notebooks over to Marschal. Cole carefully places them on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MARSCHAL
dialogues.text: Is this for me? Mr. Marschal fingers the notebooks then reaches for his t glasses hanging from his neck. He places them on the tip his nose and inspects the notebooks six inches from his f

dialogues.speaker: MR. MARSCHAL
dialogues.text: What's this? Jill's keeping a diary. Malcolm takes an involuntary step forward. Mr. Marschal starts flipping through the notebooks.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MARSCHAL
dialogues.text: She's full of surprises... He gets to the last book. His hands become still as he st at the final page of writing.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MARSCHAL
dialogues.text: (whispers) She hasn't written anything for some time. Beat. Mr. Marschal slowly looks up from the notebooks. Looks up to Cole. Cole just stands quietly. Mr. Marschal's eyes slowly fill with tears of realization They gently spill down his weathered face.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MARSCHAL
dialogues.text: Oh no... Cole takes a deep breath. Trying hard not to cry himself. The sight of Mr. Marschal weeping shakes Cole. Cole softly lays his hand on Mr. Marschal's silver hair. Mr. Marschal reaches up and clutches his small hand. They stay like that for a while. Beat. Mr. Marschal lets go and brings the notebooks tighter to his body. Cole quietly walks to Malcolm who stands motionless. He stares down at Cole in a daze. Cole turns his head, crying.  33.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (softly) Stop looking at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm sits still in his office chair. His eyes are fixe at a point in space. He brings a slim, black tape recorde to his mouth. CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: April or March of Eighty-seven. Two weeks into sessions with Vincent Gray. I was treating a couple, Donald and Robin Wagner, who had lost their child to Leukemia. They were waiting with Vincent in the reception room of the downtown clinic. They were alone together maybe fifteen minutes. When I entered the room, all three were crying. The Wagner's progress from that afternoon was dramatic and sudden .... As if some door had been opened for them. (beat ) I'm not at all clear what happened in those fifteen minutes. But I now believe Vincent tried to tell me something, show me something and I didn't listen. (beat) Cole Sear allowed me to witness something today. (beat ) This time I'm going to listen. A long silence. CLICK. The tape recorder turns off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn holds a laundry basket on her hip as she fiddles wit the thermostat in the hall. The house is cold. Lynn wears a winter jacket in the house. Lynn turns and moves into the shadowy hallway. No lights. The house seems somewhat ominous. Beat. Lynn's eyes dart to an open guest room like she just saw something.  34. She stares in the doorway until a SOUND TURNS HER IN THE DIRECTION OF THE FAMILY ROOM. She picks up balled-up boy's sweat socks and dirty T-shir laying on the carpet. When she reaches the end of the hal she HITS A LIGHT SWITCH. The hall LIGHTS UP REVEALING A WALL OF PHOTOS. Lynn forms a tiny smile. Snapshots of Cole and Lynn's life hang before her eyes. Cole's birthday parties... Lynn and Cole at an amusement park... Cole under the Christmas tree... Cole on Lynn's shoulders in a pool... Cole with a group of neighbors at a barbecue Lynn takes a step forward. Lynn's face betrays the fact that she notices something she never noticed before. She touches a photo of three-year-old Cole.

dialogues.speaker: LIKE SOMETHING CAUGHT IN MOTION.
dialogues.text: Lynn looks to the adjacent photo -- the barbecue photo -- Everyone stands with hot dogs and sodas. Lynn searches th picture. Her eyes suddenly stop at the TINIEST BLUR OF WH LIGHT STREAKING AROUND COLE.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN FINDS A BLUR.
dialogues.text: Lynn takes it all in curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn moves into Cole's room with the laundry basket balan on her hip. The Walkman headphones on her head blares A MUFFLED TECHNO DANCE BEAT. Lynn starts picking clothes up around Cole's room. This bedroom is an eerie place. The shadows seem to make shapes and figures. All the furniture is wood -- old fashioned. The lamps, the paintings on the wall -- antiqu as well. The most striking feature of the room, however, is the homemade tent created from bedsheets and blankets tied to chairs and bureaus. It takes up a large corner of the roo  35. A sign hangs over the bedsheets.

dialogues.speaker: "DO NOT ENTER"
dialogues.text: Lynn grabs the spiderman P.J.s that drape over the tent. A German Shepherd Puppy sleeps on the pillow. SEBASTIAN lifts his head sleepily and peers at Lynn before returnin to his slumber. Lynn slowly reaches for a picture frame that peeks out fr under Cole's pillow. Slides it out... It's a VACATION PHO of a couple. Lynn and Cole and a man. The man looks in every way a larger version of Cole. The picture has a visible effect on Lynn. She lets out a shaky breath before returning the photo to its hiding pla Lynn pulls a pair of school uniform pants off the wooden roll cover desk next to the bed. The desk is covered with loose leaf papers filled with writings. Lynn's eyes are drawn to the papers. Her curious gaze turns serious. Her mouth opens a tiny bi involuntarily. THE PAPERS are strewn with lines of handwriting. Countles lines. Thousands of words... Some horizontal, some vertical... The writing moves in arcs and flows in various size -- wr at great speed -- every word connected by a single pen st everything written in one continuous motion. Lynn slowly spins the papers, taking in some of the phras ...Christ break the freaking glass oh no God no what the hell is going on Quiet the damn baby I'll cut you I swear someone stop the burning I'll kill you I'll kill all you bastard... The words go on and on. Lynn removes her hands from the paper. She pulls her headphones off slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm stares as the rain pelts the windows of the den.  36.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: ...SO your dad lives in Pittsburgh with a lady who works in a toll booth.

dialogues.speaker: COLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What if she has to pee when she's working? You think she just holds it?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I don't know. I was just thinking the same thing. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You ask a lot of questions about my dad today. How come? Cole is playing behind the couch. All we see is the top o his head.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Sometimes, we don't even know it, but we do things to draw attention. Do things so we can express how we feel about issues... Divorce or whatever. Every now and then we get glimpses of things Cole is play with peeking over the back of the couch, but we can't qui make out what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: One night, as an example... leave something on a desk for someone to find. The top of Cole's head stops moving.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Cole, have you ever heard of something called free-writing? Or free- association writing? Cole shakes his head, "No."

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: It's when you put a pencil in your hand and put the pencil to a paper and you just start writing... You don't think about what you're writing... You don't read over what you're writing... You just keep your hand moving.  Cole has become very still. He looks right at Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: After awhile if you keep your hand moving long enough, words and thoughts start coming out you didn't even know you had in you... Sometimes they're things you heard from somewhere... Sometimes they're feelings deep inside... (beat ) Have you ever done any free- association writing, Cole? Beat. Cole nods, "Yes."

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: What'd you write?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Words.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: What kind of words?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Upset words. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Did you ever write any upset words before your father left? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I don't remember. Malcolm watches him carefully. Beat. Malcolm waves the question off casually.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Can you do something for me? Malcolm smiles. He rises and grabs his coat.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Think about what you want from our time together. What our goal should be?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Something I want? 37.  38.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: If we could change something in your life, anything at all, what would you like that to be? Cole's brow furrows as he thinks about it carefully.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You don't have to answer now. Malcolm heads for the door, stops when Cole emerges from behind the couch. Cole is wearing his father's jacket, it hangs to the ground like a dress.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Instead of something I want, can I have something I don't want? Malcolm turns back to Cole. Malcolm nods "Yes." Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I don't want to be scared anymore. Cole's sad eyes stare up at Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surface of Malcolm's desk is covered with open texts. Malcolm pours over a thick reference book. He circles a phrase... ".,.resulting bruises and abrasions on arms and legs may, fact, be self-inflicted." Malcolm appears disturbed by the thoughts running through his head. ANNA'S MUFFLED VOICE CARRIES DOWN THE STAIRS. His face turns up to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM

Each step faster than the next.

Malcolm stands in the aisle a little out of breath. He ho his hand to his side as he winces a bit. Malcolm's eyes float up to the balcony where toy soldiers sit on the bannister. Cole's head pops up.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Hello again. He looks down and studies Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You been running around? Malcolm nods, "Yes."

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: It makes you feel better? Malcolm nods, "Yes" again.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I like to run around. It's good exercise. (beat ) You want to ask me questions now? Malcolm shakes his head, "No."

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You want to be a lance corporal in Company M, 3rd Battalion, 7th Marines? We're being dispatched to the Quang Nam province. Cole holds up his plastic rifleman. Malcolm's eyes show h understands now.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Maybe later. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Something happened, didn't it?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Yes, it did.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Are you wigging out?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.  85.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: We're not gonna start crying again, are we?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: No, we're not.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What happened? Beat. Malcolm glances around the empty church before looking ba up to Cole.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: These people... People that died and are still hanging around. Maybe they weren't ready to go. Cole studies Malcolm's passionate face. A new face.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You really look better.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Maybe they wake up that morning thinking they have a thousand things to do and a thousand days left to do them in... And then all of a sudden, it's all taken away. No one asked them. It's just gone...

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You have nice red in your cheeks now.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Do you know what 'Yo no quiero morir' is? Cole shakes his head, "No."

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: It's Spanish. It means... 'I don't want to die.' (beat ) Not all the ghosts are scary, are they? Like Mrs. Marschal?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: What do those ghosts want when they talk to you? Think real careful now, Cole... Cole stops moving. He looks over the balcony railing at Malcolm. Malcolm's Malcolm nods "Yes."

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Just help.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Yes! I think that's right!... I think they all want that. Even the scary ones...

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You believe now? stare is unwavering.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I believe both of you now. (beat ) And I think I might know how to make them go away.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I think they know you're one of those guys rare people can see them. (beat ) You need to help them. Each one of them. (beat ) Everyone wants to be heard. Everyone. Cole takes a big sigh. Fiddles with his riflemen.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What if they don't want help? what if they're just angry and they want to hurt somebody?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I don't think that's the way it works, Cole. Cole looks nervous.  87.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: How do you know for sure? Malcolm's eyes are drawn to Cole's arm. Peeking out from under his shirt sleeve are a set of cuts. Malcolm gazes a them.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I don't. Cole and Malcolm stand silently in the center aisle of th back of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm moves around the corner on his street. His mind surges with thoughts. And then he glances up. His steps slow to a complete stop. Further down the sidewalk, coming out of the front door o his house is SEAN. Malcolm's face turns to stone. He watches as Sean comes down the front stairs and starts across the street. A sudden rage surges up. Malcolm moves towards Sean fast. Sean reaches his car and enters it. He doesn't notice the figure closing in on him. THE ENGINE STARTS. Malcolm reaches the car a second late. Sean pulls away into traffic almost hitting another car a he does. Malcolm watches the car disappear down the next street. Beat. Malcolm turns and looks up at his home with unchecked ang and overwhelming pain erupting his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm stands in his foyer. Anna is sitting on the stairs, phone in her hand. She fac away from the front. Malcolm's a ball of tension as he listens to Anna talk in the phone.  88.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: ...You just walked out. You're probably on your way home. I'm leaving this message... I just didn't get to say what I meant... (beat ) I know you're confused. It's just... I'm not prepared to do this, Sean. (beat ) I don't want to be ashamed of that. I don't want to have to make excuses for that. (beat ) And I wanted to tell you... I bought your present wholesale from a friend. I didn't even pay tax on it. You don't need someone cheap like that. (beat ) By the way, it's a non-refundable item, it's scratched on the bottom. (beat ) Are you smiling?... I hope you're smiling. (beat ) I'll see you at the store. Beat. A long silence. Then WE HEAR ANNA GENTLY HANG UP. Malcolm leans back against an old radiator. Beat. His eyes close as the SOUND OF HIS WIFE'S FOOTSTEPS RISES THE STAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is silent. No movement. Cole is in his pajamas asleep on the floor of the TENT. Curled up next to him is Sebastian. They sleep surrounded by statues and pictures. Cole's eyes open as he hears HIS MOTHER'S DISTANT VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Cole... (beat ) Cole, what's happening... Cole quickly gets up and rushes out of the tent. His foot catches one of the chairs the tent is fastened to. He stumbles out. He doesn't realize one of the bedsheets com loose.  89. It folds to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't stop as he moves through the shadowy hall and pushes open his mother's bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole stands in the doorway to his mother's bedroom. He lo over the room carefully. Everything is still. Lynn's room is sparse. No paintings, no accessaries. A be without a frame sits in the corner. A table with a sewing machine fills the other side of the room. HIS MOTHER'S VOICE turns his attention back to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Cole, what's happening to you? Cole looks down and finds his mother laying in her bed. H face contorted in deep sadness as she speaks in her sleep

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Is someone hurting you?... I'll beat their asses. Cole smiles at his mother as he moves to her side. Touche her face with his tiny fingers.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (whispers) Momma, you sleep now. His touch seems to have an effect. Lynn becomes still in her sleep. Cole watches her carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole closes the door to his mother's bedroom shut. He sta still in the hallway. Lets out a heavy sigh... HIS BREATH ROLLS IN A TINY CLOUD IN FRONT OF HIM. Cole's brow furrows. He breathes again. This time intentionally. Watches as his breath materializes in the suddenly ice cold air.  90. Every muscle in Cole's eight-year-old body becomes rigid. He takes a second before moving through the inky darkness the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole hurries to fix his tent. He ties the collapsed bedsh in a knot on the edge of the chair. He checks it carefull before entering the tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Cole turns around, he stops breathing. AN EIGHT-YEAR-OLD GIRL VOMITS ON HERSELF IN HIS TENT. She finishes and looks up at Cole with drawn eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: I'm feeling much better now. The girl reaches out with her withered and emaciated hand tiny tubes hang from her wrists. She scratches Cole as he tumbles back terrified out of the tent. The whole tent collapses --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole runs hard out of his bedroom and down the hall to th living room. He gets down to the ground and slides under the wooden-legged couch. Sebastian is already huddled in fear under the couch. Col presses as far back as he can and waits. COLE'S P.O.V. -- is of the living room floor. Chair legs. Coffee table base. Rugs... Everything is still. Cole holds his breath. He waits. Beat. Nothing happens. He takes his first short breaths and watches the room for any sign of movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few minutes later. Cole is now standing in his doorway. He stares at the hunched figure covered by the collapsed tent.  91. BEAT. Cole makes a decision. He looks like he is going to cry -- fights it back. He walks towards it. Reaches down and slowly pulls the sh off the figure. The girl vomits one more time before look up at Cole.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: I'm feeling much better. Cole and the little girl stare silently at each other. Co holds her stare with trembling eyes. He opens his mouth -- it takes a while before the words c out.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Do you want to tell me something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

Cole leans his head against the glass of the scratched wi Cole's large eyes drink in the passing scenery. COLE'S P.O.V. -- A dark, abandoned building stretches for entire block on one side. A MAN IN A GREY, FULL-BODIED

dialogues.text: She came a long way to visit me, didn't she?  92.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I guess she did. Cole falls into deep thoughts as he stares down at his dr shoes. Malcolm slips back into silence. The city bus slithers through the old Philadelphia street working its way downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modest home sits on a corner. Its small lawn, groomed carefully. Rows of parked cars spill out from the drivewa onto the streets. People in suits and dark dresses move somberly in and out the front door of the home. Cole and Malcolm join the visitors as they walk slowly to the doors. A frail, little girl about four years of age sits in a da dress on the swings in front of the house. Visitors say hello to her as they pass. She doesn't say anything back.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Her little sister? Cole nods, "Yes." Malcolm and Cole watch her for a moment before following others into the modest corner home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The home is packed with people. The gathering of mourners is standing room only. The AIR IS FILLED WITH DOZENS OF HUSHED CONVERSATIONS.

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: ...can you imagine being a child in a bed for two years? We move to.

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: ...God help them... A FAMILY PORTRAIT HANGS NEAR THE FRONT DOOR. Two girls, o bigger, one smaller sit on the ground in front of their m and father. Their smiling faces welcome the mourners. Malcolm and Cole are standing at the bottom of a staircas Waiting. The front door opens as another group arrives. Malcolm no to Cole as the foyer fills up. The two of them quietly disappear upstairs.

Cole stares at the shut door like he doesn't want to go i His eyes move to the large, colorful map of the world tha dons the hallway wall. He gazes at the many countries and continents. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I wish I were somewhere else.

dialogues.text: (soft) Where will you go, where no one has died? Cole stares at the map and then turns to Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Don't go home, okay?  94.

dialogues.text: I definitely won't. Cole turns and stares quietly at the door. He waits a lon time before reaching for the doorknob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole closes the door behind him. He turns and gazes at th girl's bedroom. There's a hospital bed near the window. The walls are covered with get-well cards and drawings fr family, friends, and school children. Her shelves are filled with puppets. All shapes and sizes of puppets. Next to the shelf is a puppet stage and a camcorder on a mini tripod sitting next to it. Cole walks to the shelf and picks up a FINGER PUPPET DANC He places it in his pocket. On the girl's desk, is a large collection of video casset The labels read, "Puppet Show Christmas 96," "Puppet Show Birthday party," "Puppet Show class trip"... Cole reads the labels carefully before moving towards the closets. He passes the bed.

dialogues.speaker: COLE'S ANKLE.

He tilts his head and looks under the bed. The emaciated little girl who came to his tent lays curle on the floor. Her bulging eyes glare at Cole. She moves suddenly. Thrusts a jewelry box forward. It slides across the wooden floor and stops just before Cole. Cole and the sickly girl stare at each other. Neither of them say a wo

As she moves through the room to the kitchen, she receives t many cards, hugs, and flowers that are offered as condole Mrs. Collins leaves the living room.  95. Malcolm watches breathlessly from the doorway as Cole mov through the many adults across the room. The girl's father, MR. COLLINS, a thin man in his late twenties, is seated on the reading chair next to aT.V. Hi face is granite. No one in the room dares to talk to him. He stares statue-like at an abstract point in the room.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Mister? The man doesn't react. Some of the guests look oddly at t little boy standing before the man.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mister. Beat. The man slowly turns and looks down at the boy stan next to him. Cole is very shaky. Malcolm watches everything anxiously. Cole stares at Mr. Collins.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Are you Kyra's daddy? The man's face begins to crumble. Beat. He nods, "yes" softly. Cole holds out the jewelry box. It trembles with his hand The father just stares at it. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: It's for you... (beat ) She wanted to tell you something. The father becomes very still. His eyes fill with a storm of confusion and pain. After the longest time, the father reaches and gently takes the box out of Cole's small hand Cole begins to back away... The father gazes at Cole as he melts into the crowd. Cole reaches Malcolm and the two then slip out of the house. The father looks down in a daze. He goes to open the jewe box. His movements are slow and strained. He lifts the latch and open the box. Mr. Collins stares at an unlabeled video cassette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People in the room start to turn as the T.V. comes on. Mr Collins is seated now.

dialogues.speaker: THE STATIC SNOW ON THE SCREEN IS QUICKLY REPLACED BY AN I
dialogues.text: TwO PUPPETS DANCE ON STAGE. WE HEAR KYRA'S VOICE SING FOR THE PUPPETS AS THEY DANCE AROUND. Her father's face forms the most heartbreaking of smiles he watches the performance. The entire room has stopped what they were doing.

dialogues.text: WE HEAR FOOTSTEPS COMING UP THE STAIRS. The puppets go li The entire stage gets lifted up. We see it carried away b Kyra. We can view the whole bedroom now. The camera is seated on her desk in the corner. Kyra climbs in bed and pretends to be sleeping when the d opens. It's Mrs. Collins. She carries in a tray of soup and a sandwich.

Places a straw into the drink. And then it happens. The image of the mother walks to a closet. Opens it. An assortment of household cleaners and sponges are kept ins She pulls out a bottle of floor cleaner. Reads the label for the ingredients. Walks back to the food tray, where s unscrews the cap on the floor cleaner. The mother pours some into the cap. Checks it.

dialogues.text: (video tape) That's too much. The mother pours some into the bottle. The remainder goes into the child's soup. She replaces the cap and puts the bottle back in the closet. The image of the mother turns to the bed carrying the tra She places the food on a metallic rolling table and swing it over the bed.  97.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. COLLINS
dialogues.text: (video tape) Kyra, time for lunch. Kyra pretends to wake from a deep sleep.

dialogues.speaker: KYRA
dialogues.text: (video tape) I'm feeling much better now. The image of the mother smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. COLLINS
dialogues.text: (video tape) I'm glad, honey. (beat ) Time for your food.

dialogues.speaker: KYRA
dialogues.text: (video tape) Can I go outside, if I eat this?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. COLLINS
dialogues.text: (video tape) We'll see. You know how you get sick in the afternoon. Kyra picks up the spoon and takes a sip. Her face crinkle at the taste. She looks up at her mother.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. COLLINS
dialogues.text: (video tape) Don't say it tastes funny. You know I don't like to hear that. Kyra slowly brings the spoon to her mouth and swallows an spoonful. The father SHUTS OFF THE TELEVISION with his trembling ha He presses his hands to his eyes like they're burning. The ROOM IS UTTERLY SILENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Collins is seated at the dining room surrounded by friends and family. She fixes one of the many bouquets of flowers on the table. It takes her a beat before she feel the stare. She looks up.  98. Standing in the doorway to the dining room is Mr. Collins A group of ashen faced guests stand in the distance behin him. Husband and wife's eyes meet. Mrs. Collins smiles softly. Mr. Collins' eyes tremble with tears.

dialogues.speaker: MR. COLLINS
dialogues.text: (soft) You were keeping her sick... The whole world stops. The mother's face registers confusion at first. Then slow realization. Her eyes glance at the many faces around her She looks back at her husband. His glare is painful. Rage filling every cell of his body. Tears falling faster down his cheeks. Mrs. Collins turns her attention back to the flowers. She concentrates with all her strength. Beat. Her hands begin to shake.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. COLLINS
dialogues.text: (to no one) I took care of her... Her words are met with ice cold stares. The first tears stream down her face. The pretty flowers of consolation i her hand tumble to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole sits on the swings next to Kyra's four-year-old sist She doesn't look up. Malcolm waits in the driveway. Watches them from a distan Cole reaches into his pocket and pulls out the little FIN PUPPET. He holds it out.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You liked it, she said. The four-year-old stares at the finger puppet, then quiet takes it in her small hands. The two children don't say anything for a while. Malcolm glances to the house, where all movements in and out of t home has ceased.  99. Cole turns to the four-year-old.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: She watched out for you. The little girl finally looks up. She has the saddest eye

dialogues.speaker: FOUR YEAR OLD
dialogues.text: Kyra's not coming back. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Not anymore. The little girl stares down at the finger puppet. Cole lightly places a hand on her shoulder. Nothing else is said. Nothing else is done. Malcolm looks across the two children on the swings. One mourning. One consoling. Malcolm takes it in, overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

Mr. Cunningham finds Cole sitting in a poor villager cost as a FEMALE TEACHER kneels next to him and makes final adjustments. Cole and the woman glance at Mr. Cunningham.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CUNNINGHAM
dialogues.text: They're calling for the stable boy. Mr. Cunningham looks around the room and then directly at Cole.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CUNNINGHAM
dialogues.text: Who were you talking to? The Female Teacher looks to Cole and nods.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE TEACHER
dialogues.text: Poor Stanley. She stands up. The entire left side of her face has been burnt horribly. Grotesquely disfigured.  100.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE TEACHER
dialogues.text: My favorite student.

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY. SHE DISAPPEARS INTO THE DARKNESS.
dialogues.text: Cole puts on his tattered hat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Thanks for giving me this part, Mr. Cunningham. Mr. Cunningham smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CUNNINGHAM
dialogues.text: You're welcome, Cole. They share a look before walking out of the prop room and entering the hall. We see them walking away.

dialogues.speaker: MR. CUNNINGHAM
dialogues.text: You know when I was in school, there was a terrible fire in this section of the theater. They rebuilt the whole thing. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It begins to rain. Malcolm pulls his jacket over his head as he scurries up the stairs of the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm stands and catches his breath in the corridor of Anthony's Academy. A teacher rushes in the hall with an armload of costumes.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Has the play started yet? The teacher hurries past Malcolm and down the hall withou saying a word.  101.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Is that a yes? The teacher scurries around a corner. Malcolm watches her curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm moves quickly to a set of double doors and opens them. He steps into the DARKNESS OF THE AUDITORIUM. The play is in full swing... Cole and a large group of costumed children are on stage. Cole holds a broom and we a worn-down costume. He stands to the side -- hidden by others. A boy in a shiny-armored costume walks to the center of t stage where a large cardboard stone is seated. A sparklin HANDLE sticks out of the top. The armored boy tries to lift it. It won't budge. Bobby, the chubby boy from the party, is dressed ina Magician's costume. He is Merlin. He steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Only he who is pure of heart can take the sword from the stone. Merlin looks to the group on stage. Looks right at Cole.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Let the boy try. The group of villagers on the stage LAUGH AND MOCK THE SUGGESTION. Tommy Tammisimo is dressed in a mismatched costume -- he hops around, clearly embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: (half -heartedly) But he's the stable boy. He cleans after the horses.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Silence village idiot! Let the boy step forward. Tommy turns a deep shade of red and hobbles off the stage Merlin looks to Cole. He smiles a true friend's smile.  102.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: Arthur... Cole hesitates. Not because he's acting. He really hesitates. It takes him a moment before he steps forward. Cole steps up to the stone. He places his hand around the handle. Begins to pull. The sword starts to come out. The villagers GASP. Cole raises the shiny sword out of the stone and high abo his head. Merlin and everyone on stage bows. A SILENCE FILLS THE AUDITORIUM. Malcolm watches his client, standing unafraid in the spot light for the first time. The villagers rise and rush to Cole. They scoop him up an carry him around the stage in celebration. Cole chuckles and then starts laughing as the group of eight-year-olds unsuccessfully to keep him up. They slowly sag and then collapse. All the students are laughing as they try to untangle themselves. Malcolm watches with utter joy as Cole becomes indistinguishable among of a group of twenty children gig and enjoying themselves on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain comes down a little stronger now on the stained glass window. Malcolm sits on the stairs in the lobby. Cole walks back and forth in front of him. Cole still holds the sword fro the play.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: How come we're so quiet? Malcolm shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I think we said everything we needed to say. (beat) Maybe it's time to say things to someone else? Someone close to you?  103.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Maybe. Cole keeps moving. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I'm not going to see you anymore, am

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: Malcolm doesn't respond for a while. He shakes his head, "No." Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You were great in the play, Cole.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: And you know what else?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Tommy Tammisimo sucked big time. Cole smiles huge. Beat. Cole's sword drags on the tile as he continues to circle around the hall. We get the idea h doesn't want to be still.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: ...Maybe we can pretend we're going to see each other tomorrow? Cole glances at Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Just for pretend. Beat. Malcolm exhales very slowly as he gets up.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Okay, Cole, I'm going to go now... I'll see you tomorrow. Cole watches as Malcolm walks down the stairs to the entr Cole stops moving.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (soft) See you tomorrow.  104. Malcolm's face shows his losing battle against his emotio He doesn't turn to look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rain-soaked bridge. A two-lane road merges to one lane around a severe car accident. A rear-ended car has jumped the sidewalk and hit the guard rail of the bridge. The dr is helped out by police. He's shaken but okay. Police fla guide the cars as they crawl by. Lynn and Cole are standing still in bumper-to-bumper traf Lynn leans her chin on the steering wheel. She tries to stare through the layer of water on the glass. She hits t windshield wipers.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: I hope nobody got hurt. Beat. Lynn glances over to Cole who sits in his seat silently.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: You're very quiet. (beat) You're mad I missed the play, aren't you? Cole shakes his head, "No."

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: I have two jobs, baby. You know how important they are for us. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: I'd give anything to have been there.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I'm ready to communicate with you now. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Communicate?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Tell you my secrets. The way he says the words gives Lynn a chill.  105.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: What is it? Cole takes a long time.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You know that accident up there?

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: (confused) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Someone got hurt.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: They did?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: A lady. She died.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Lynn leans over the steering wheel. She wipes the windshi with her palm to see better.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: You can see her?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Yes. Lynn gazes out the windshield at the line of red tail lig Beat.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Standing next to my window.

dialogues.speaker: WINDOW.
dialogues.text: Lynn looks over slowly. She doesn't see anything outside his window. She eyes Cole.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Cole, you're scaring me.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: They scare me too sometimes.  106.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: They?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Dead people.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Dead people?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Ghosts. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: You see ghosts, Cole?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: They want me to do things for them.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: They talk to you? Cole nods, "Yes."

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: They tell you to do things? Cole nods "Yes" again. Lynn becomes upset. She nods with grave understanding. Cole watches her.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What are you thinking, Momma?

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: ...I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You think I'm a freak? Lynn's eyes moves to Cole.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Look at my face. Cole gazes at her intense expression.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: I would never think that about you ever... Got it?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Got it. BEAT. Cole smiles a tiny smile. Lynn glances down.  107.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Just let me think for a second. She drowns in her thoughts. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Grandma says hi. Lynn looks up sharply.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: She says she's sorry for taking the bumble bee pendant. She just likes it a lot.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Grandma comes to visit me sometimes. Lynn becomes still. Her face is unreadable. When she spea her words are extremely controlled.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: Cole, that's very wrong. Grandma's gone. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I know. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: She wanted me to tell you--

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: (soft) Cole, please stop.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: She wanted me to tell you, she saw you dance. Lynn's eyes lock on Cole's.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: She said when you were little, you and her had a fight right before your dance recital. You thought she didn't come to see you dance. She did. Lynn brings her hands to her mouth.  108.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: She hid in the back so you wouldn't see... She said you were like an angel. Lynn begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: She said, you came to her where they buried her. Asked her a question... She said the answer is "Everyday." Lynn covers her face with her hands. The tears roll out through her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: (whispers) What did you ask? Beat. Lynn looks at her son. She barely gets the words out.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: (crying) Do I make her proud? Cole moves closer to Lynn. She cradles him in her arms. Mother and son hold each other tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm walks quietly down the sidewalk towards his home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm enters the living room and smiles at what he sees Anna is asleep in a chair. She's curled up ina ball. Ina way, she looks like a little girl. Their WEDDING VIDEO PLAYS SOFTLY ON THE TELEVISION.  109. Malcolm watches himself and Anna cutting their wedding ca THE CROWD APPLAUDS AS THEY FEED EACH OTHER PIECES. Malcolm turns from the television and takes a seat next t Anna. He gazes upon his wife softly.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (whispers) Anna, I've been so lost. (beat ) I need my best friend. Silence. Malcolm gazes for a beat before looking down.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I miss you. Malcolm's eyes move back up. He looks at his sleeping wif ANNA'S TALKING IN HER SLEEP. Malcolm can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I miss you. Beat. Her lips move again. Eyes never open.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Why, Malcolm?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: What, Anna? What did I do? What's made you so sad? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Why did you leave me?

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I didn't leave you. Beat. She becomes silent. Anna falls back into deep sleep her arm slides down. SOMETHING SHINY FALLS OUT AND ROLLS THE GROUND. Malcolm's eyes watch as it comes to a stop... Beat. He gazes curiously at a GOLD WEDDING BAND laying on the wood floor. Confusion washes over his face. He looks to Anna's hand.. An identical gold wedding ring sits on her finger. Beat. Malcolm looks down at his own hand... HIS WEDDING RING IS GONE.  110. Malcolm is completely lost. He takes a couple steps back. Looks around in confusion... His eyes come to rest on the door to his basement office. He looks in disbelief at the set of DEAD BOLT LOCKS on th door. Malcolm doesn't know what the hell's going on... His eyes are drawn to the dining table... Only ONE PLACE SETTING i out on the tabletop. His eyes search again -- they finally lock on the WEDDING VIDEO PLAYING. Malcolm watches images of himself on the screen... His eyes fill with a storm of emotions... Malcolm looks to Anna's face and becomes very still. Beat CLOSE ON ANNA... TILL HER SLEEPING FACE FILLS THE FRAME..

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (like he's falling down a deep hole) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna rushes across the room to a crumpled Malcolm laying the floor. Malcolm's hands are clutched at his side. Anna pries his hands away to reveal the tiniest tear in h shirt. Anna's eyes catch something dark -- moving... A POOL OF BLOOD IS FORMING UNDER MALCOLM. She slowly turns him over on his side... A horrific sight... An enormous exit wound on his lower back pours out blood uncontrollab Malcolm's jaw is locked open. His breaths are long and strained. ANNA IS SCREAMING, BUT HER VOICE SOUNDS FAR AWAY. Malcolm's open jaw releases a long strained breath and th becomes silent. Anna tries to cover the wound with her ha desperately.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM'S VOICE SHAKES THE ROOM.
dialogues.text: Anna just sleeps. Malcolm staggers back. His breathing erratic. He takes a seat across from her. He looks at his wife and suddenly becomes very still. Anna's still curled up asleep, but tears are falling from her shut eyes. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Don't cry. Anna doesn't move, but her tears seem to fall a little fa

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: I think I have to go. Malcolm's mind is racing.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (realizing) I just needed to do a couple of things. (beat) And I needed to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Tell me. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You were never second... Ever. Malcolm gazes at his wife. Tears fall from both their eye

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: You sleep now, Anna. Everything will be different in the morning. Anna lays still.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Malcolm.  112.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Goodnight, sweetheart. The room falls into silence. Malcolm sits still across fr his wife. He drinks her in with his eyes. Malcolm leans back in the chair. Slowly closes his eyes. They close shut.

dialogues.speaker: FALLING BACK INTO A PEACEFUL SLEEP.
dialogues.text: WE PULL BACK to reveal Anna alone in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (on tape) ...I think I've had too much to drink. Malcolm smiles as he takes a sip. The guests chuckle as they watch. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (on tape) I just have to say, this day today has been one very special day... I wish we all could stay and play. The crowd erupts in LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (on tape) What? Malcolm looks around at everyone's smiling faces. Beat. Malcolm takes his time. He looks just past the came

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: Anna, I never thought I'd feel the things I'm feeling. I never thought I'd be able to stand up in front of my friends and family and tell them what's inside me... Today I can... Malcolm's eyes fill with water.  113.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM
dialogues.text: (softly) Anna Crowe... I am in love. In love I am.
